result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Daniel W Dechant in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  

Matter is dismissed and read into case:  21CF1075
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:00 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Daniel W Dechant in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Wolff provides an update, he is requesting a plea and sentencing date in about 3 weeks, if possible.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Voge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:25 AM Defendant Daniel W Dechant in court with attorney Abigail Broze for attorney Peter M Wolff.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Date remains as previously set for March 28, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Hearing on March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Peter Wolff has been appointed to represent the defendant.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Preliminary hearing on February 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

02:42 PM Defendant Daniel W Dechant in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is currently on a probation and parole hold.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  The Court puts the defendant on notice that if this Court receives a WCS non compliance report, the Court would be inclined to issue a warrant for the defendants arrest.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
